ygData.subject: Re: video cards
ygData.msgSnippet: Should be a huge difference. The Ti is only bettered by the new Radion. The Mx is just a hotrod Gforce2. I have the Mx only because I don t have an agp slot on
ygData.messageBody:
Should be a huge difference. The Ti is only bettered by the new
Radion. The Mx is just a hotrod Gforce2. I have the Mx only because I
don't have an agp slot on my Emachine. Had to get the best pci I
could, which was the Mx.

Probably the greatest difference you will see is in lag. Line lag it
can't help, but lag internal to your system is. With the 64mb memory
you won't get the same performance as the 128, as more memory is the
key to better eq. Still, you should see an improvement.

Barto

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Justin" <pavisoj@q...> wrote:
> I have a question for you all. I am picking up a GeForce4 TI
4200 64 mb video card and I was wondering how much of a difference
that was from a GeForce4 MX440 04 mb video card. Will I see much of
a difference? I was just wondering about that because I remember a
while back a discussion about the cards on this board before. Well I
would apperciate any comments on this topic. according to the
manufacturer did say theis card did better than thier 128 mb version
of the same card due to the clock speed of the ram. Just what i have
heard.
